rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Horizontal-Generic.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the subject characteristics were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the subject characteristics at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the SC CRF using the date (SCDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SCDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Horizontal-Generic.SCCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the subject characteristics category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Category for Subject Characteristic
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: [SCTESTCD]_SCCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the subject characteristics??

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Horizontal-Generic.SCSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the subject characteristics subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the SCCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column header. SCSCAT can only be used if there is an SCCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of SCCAT. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Subcategory for Subject Characteristic
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: [SCTESTCD]_SCSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the subject characteristics?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Horizontal-Generic.SCPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if subject characteristics information was collected. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication of whether any subject characteristics were collected.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When the SDTM-based datasets are created, the value of SCPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF when implemented on a specific test basis. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: SC Assessment Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SCSTAT. If [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF ="N", the value of SCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF ="Y", SCSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SCCAT and SCSCAT, SCTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SCTESTCD would be assigned SCALL and an appropriate test name ( SCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF

fields.implementationNotes: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. fields.label: Subject Characteristics Group ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
